intro: Linaria microsepala, commonly known as the small-sepal toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are arranged oppositely along the stems. Linaria microsepala is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
